oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Population Study of Grey-Necked Wood Rails in Captivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Williams, Louise Hammond
Rundel, Richard S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For a period of about three months Ihave been studying Grey-necked W0odrails(Aramides cajanae) at the Los AngelesZoo. The purpose of this paper is torecount my observations of their socialstructure and their suitability as a captivebird. The observations were made in thelarge, well-planted flight-cage at the zoo.It is situated on the side of a hill and,therefore, is built on three levels whichare connected by a pathway. The threelevels can be further divided into smallerareas, each having its own characteristics.On the lower level there are two smallpools connected by a stream. The poolsare on slightly different levels, thus necessitatinga waterfall, which effectively actsas a divider separating the two areas. Theentire flight-cage has an estimated area ofabout 21,000 cubic...
